comment: great teacher

Prof. Hong puts great effort into his course. The daily quizesassignments are set up in such a way to be used as study material for the midterm and final. Every lecture he has prepared notes that you have to print but in the end you basically have a book that can be referenced later. He is strict but patient - take his class as serious as he does.

Good professor. It would help if quizzes were theoretical like the tests are. Would take him again. Use of books in the class is a plus because all the content is there, you just have to put in extra work if you want to pass.

This class is very difficult because of the tests that are given. The lectures and labs are very clear and he does a great job setting you up for the labs. However, the tests are near impossible to pass. He teaches the theory and you have to apply it to very difficultly worded questions. Also there are only two tests, the midterm and the final.

Hard to understand. If you don't understand something don't bother acting he'll just tell you to "Try harder" and walk away. Quizzes everyday in class, along with homework everyday. If you don't have a printer your screwed I have to print on average 12 pages for class everyday(he makes you print your own textbook).  I would avoid taking again.

Very thorough & tries to make everything really clear. Quiz everyday, homework everyday, classwork everyday, midterm & final, so there are a lot of grading opportunities. Wants you write certain answers verbatim to what was said in class, which seem a bit unnecessary & weird since his syntax on tests isn't good enough to demand such.

The only professor I would recommend for structures. He is extremely clear with correct answers and test formatting. At first he can be intimidating, but there is a clear method in his teaching and it is very effective.

Professor Hong is the best professor to take for structures. He is very linear. Show up to class because if you miss any more than a day you will not be able to keep up. Over all he is a good professor.

Frankly the only structures professor I would recommend. He  is EXTREMELY CLEAR about what we need to learn and how to do it. HE EVEN BANGS ON THE TABLE AND SAYS THIS IS QUESTION 3 ON THE MIDTERM. He wants you to learn. It just sucks the university is making him leave (probably because he doesn't confuse you just to do it like all architects do)
like the method professor to teach.

Easily one of the best professors I've had. He knows his stuff and how to teach it. Pay strong attention in class as homework will be tougher than examples in class. This is testing your comprehension rather than memorizing the lecture.  More detail could be given on returned homework and quizzes in order to help you learn from mistakes.
He is a great professor! He prepares you very well for the ARE Exam. He makes sure that you understand the material very well. He uses a lot of different softwares and methods to teach the material.
Do the work and pay attention you will learn which in my opinion is more important than the grade.

Hong is a Great teacher and really makes everything easy to understand now matter what level of physics or math you have previously taken. His accent doesnt really get in the way, and will repeat things over and over again to make sure that you understand the material. There is a lot of busy work, but it really helps you understand the concepts.
Best Structures Teacher! Take Him

Prof. Hong goes the extra mile to make sure all of his students have a clear understanding of structural principles. He dumbs everything down for your understanding, but he kinda hits you with an extremely complex midterm and final examination that leaves you speechless because he doesn't teach you in the same format that he tests you on. Study!!!

He is hands down the best teacher for teaching structures!! He gives great clarity and is patients when teaching concepts. He understands the subject very well. Even though he thinks that we should know the subject matter, he will still work through the problems until you understand. Tough and strict but will def prepare you for the ARE exam.

The best structures professor at Southern Poly. Hong can teach complicated math to any level of learner by clarifying basic concepts, endlessly repeating what you need to know, and providing key steps to problem solving. He test you like he teaches so no surprises on the test. Excellent math professor.

Very clear lectures.  Good analogies for complicated theories.  Just make sure not to disrupt class, he is very strict as far as no talkingeatingskipping.  Pop quizzes are not hard, just make sure that you are there on time to take them.
Really enjoyed the class. The labs, the homework, the quizes, and the tests all connect.

A potential area to improve would be spending a few minutes reviewing specific concepts from Structures I that tie to what is currently being taught in Structures II.  Yes, the instructor claims there may be no time to do so; yet, class ends 30 mins earlier at times or starts 15 minutes late. Reviewing will increase students' performance. Thanks.

Tough on grading, but fair. That's how you learn. He is clear about the topics when he lectures. If something is confusing, then ask and he will help you to understand. Take the class seriously. He is there to help you learn, not to teach you. I would definitely take him for my next class. I think he is the best structures professor out there.

Very clear lectures; however, classwork and homework does not prepare you for the tough tests. He teaches you the basics, and the work is straightforward.  Follow his directions closely, and most importantly, don't miss any classes!
Very clear in his lectures but you really have to pay attention and do your homework.

He is very organized and makes you organized too. Attendance is mandatory if you want to pass because you will get behind if you dont. He is very helpful with teaching you from the basics up, and is available most of the time no matter what. He gives a quiz every class so dont skip out on homework. Overall good teacher. Just do EXACTLY what he says

Took him 2nd yr, 2nd sem. Great professor considering he had very little time to prepare for it.  He took lagerstroms place.His classes are step by step, if you pay attention the first time you'll get it. He does a lot of repetition so make sure you understand,  and he is very tedious in his instructions.  Very helpful and useful. Organization=key
